subject: Enhancement Request: Assert.fail(Exception e) could be useful.
msgSnippet: Hello, Presently, there are two methods to junit.framework.Assert to fail a test. public static void fail(java.lang.String message) Fails a test with the given
messageBody:
Hello,

Presently, there are two methods to junit.framework.Assert
to fail a test.

public static void fail(java.lang.String message)
Fails a test with the given message

public static void fail()
Fails a test with no message.

The following method could be useful..
public static void fail(Exception e)
Fails a test with a message containing stack trace of given exception.

The entire stack trace is very useful for debugging purposes.
Ajay
